name: Milagro

features.name: Milagro Downport
features.description: Cracked ferrocrete landing pad, single nav beacon, prefab customs shack. No refined fuel. More customs officers than landing pads. Law Level A means exhaustive inspections.
features.campaignNotes: PCs arrive here. Comedic bureaucratic customs (Inspector Brak). Asao WANTED poster moment. Anagathics risk.

features.name: Downport Dome
features.culture: Mixed — most diverse dome, most transient. Trade district.
features.description: Surrounds the starport. Where offworlders stay. Shipping offices, freight companies, cheap accommodations. CCF and other trade interest offices located here.
features.campaignNotes: James investigates shipping district here. Splicer Mako operates here. Renna Vasik (CCF office) here.

features.name: Exile's Rest
features.culture: Old Transportees — original 750s penal colony settlers. Proudest, most bitter.
features.description: Oldest dome (founded 756). Forinean scratch-art covers every corridor. The Voiceless Song echoes through hydroponics bays. Remembrance gatherings held monthly.
features.campaignNotes: Cultural intel items strongest here. Brother Caspar Dane's meditation hall. The Closed-Fist Greeting is universal.

features.name: Haven
features.culture: Resettlement Wave — 992 mass deportation survivors. Largest group, pragmatic.
features.description: Largest dome. Government center, civil service headquarters, food distribution hub. Functional but grim. Delia Cade's office is here.
features.campaignNotes: Delia Cade operates from here. Synthi-bread sharing ritual. Government bureaucracy. Act 2 investigation base.

features.name: Crystalline
features.culture: Elite Exiles — fallen Forinean oligarchs. Better-maintained, imported fixtures.
features.description: Elite dome with higher maintenance standards. Residents preserve Forinean high-culture: education, social hierarchy, aesthetic refinement. Pre-deportation corporate documentation archives.
features.campaignNotes: Anagathics buyer from here. Corporate intelligence for James. Elite Exiles disdain 'common' Milagrans.

features.name: Last Light
features.culture: Post-Collapse survivors. Tightest community, deepest distrust of authority.
features.description: Newest dome (built 1082 during post-abandonment chaos). Emergency construction visible — mismatched hull plating, improvised life support. Residents teach children escape routes before reading.
features.campaignNotes: Splicer Mako's territory. Post-Collapse witnesses with Forine horror stories. Adventure seed: pressure seal failure.

features.name: The Brine Flats
features.description: Milagro's largest liquid body — technically a frozen brine lake. Ice mining operations extract water. Spiritual significance to Old Transportees.
features.campaignNotes: Visible from Exile's Rest and Haven. The Remembrance tradition includes memorial for those who died trying to cross it on foot during the chaos years.

regions.name: The Barrens
regions.description: Northern polar wastes. Cratered ice and regolith. Nothing survives unprotected. The earliest penal colony survey teams mapped this region and declared it 'worthless' — the name stuck.

regions.name: Brine Basin
regions.description: Central frozen ocean and surrounding ice fields. Subsurface liquid water detected. Ice mining operations supply the domes. The Basin is Milagro's most valuable natural resource.

regions.name: Southern Ice Cap
regions.description: Permanent ice cap at southern latitudes. Kilometers thick. Contains trace organics useful for CHONP processing. Automated mining rigs operate here.

regions.name: The Dome Corridor
regions.description: The arc of relatively flat terrain connecting all five domes. Surface transit routes (sealed vehicles) follow this corridor. Most infrastructure runs underground along this path.

arrivalBriefing:
Milagro resolves on sensors as a gray-brown marble scarred by impact craters and ice sheets, orbiting a sullen red dwarf that barely qualifies as a sun. The world's five domes appear as pale blisters on the nightside — clusters of light in an ocean of frozen nothing.

Descent reveals the scale of desolation: regolith plains stretching to every horizon, exposed bedrock ridges, and the dull gleam of the Brine Basin's frozen surface. The atmosphere is essentially vacuum — trace gases that wouldn't sustain a candle flame.

Milagro Downport is a cracked ferrocrete pad surrounded by prefab structures. The customs shack looms larger than the landing facilities. Even before the ramp lowers, the crew can see the inspectors lining up — clipboards, scanners, and the weary patience of professionals who have all day and nothing better to do.

gmQuickRef.population: 90M in 5 domed cities. Rest is frozen wasteland/ice.
gmQuickRef.hazards: Trace atmosphere (vacc suit outside domes). 0.26G. -25°C average. Crumbling dome infrastructure.
gmQuickRef.firstImpressions: Narrow corridors, harsh fluorescent light, recycled air, scratch-art everywhere, armed customs officers, gallows humor.
